metadata.Title: CVE-2020-11039 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description: In FreeRDP less than or equal to 2.0.0, when using a manipulated server with USB redirection enabled (nearly) arbitrary memory can be read and written due to integer overflows in length checks. This has been patched in 2.1.0.

criterions.comment: freerdp: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
